data.title: About Us / CHClC PROVIDERS
data.text:
Clinic Location:

West 11th Clinic

3321 W. 11th Ave.

Eugene, OR 97402

Phone:

(541) 682‚Äê3550

Specialty:

Family Practice, adults 18+

Language Skills:

English, Spanish

Briana received her bachelor‚Äôs degree in Community Studies and a minor in Education in 2001. She earned her graduate degree in Nursing from Columbia School of Nursing in 2008.

Briana has a certification by AANP. She has worked as a nurse practitioner in community health for the past eight years providing primary care, chronic disease management, health promotion and disease prevention for adults. Briana joined our practice in 2015. Briana grew up in Eugene and she excited to come back to the Eugene community after being away for a while.

She enjoys reading, music and spending time with her family. Briana has a passion for working in community health and providing high quality health care to her patients.

Monarch Team

Clinic Location:

MLK-Primary Care

2411 Martin Luther King Jr Blvd

Eugene, OR 97401

Phone:

(541) 682‚Äê3550

Specialty:

Family Practice, ages 18+

Language Skills:

English

Karen is a Physician Assistant; she earned her Master of Science degree from Western University of Health Sciences in 2010. In 2005, Karen earned her paramedic degree and afterwards earned a bachelor‚Äôs degree in General Science from Oregon State University in 2008.

Karen has specialized experience in Obstetrics, Gynecology and Gastroenterology. She joined our practice in January 2015.

As a native Eugenean, Karen is passionate about providing high quality care to the community and takes pride in her ability to connect and communicate with patients. Karen and her husband have three children and enjoy going to the coast, jogging, hiking; and spending time with her many family members that call Eugene home.

Orange TeamClinic Location:

RiverStone Clinic

2073 Olympic Street

Springfield, OR 97477

Phone:

(541) 682-3550

Specialty:

Pediatrics, ages 0-16

Language Skills:

English

Dr. Colgrove graduated from Vanderbilt University in Nashville, TN, where he completed his medical school and pediatric training. His primary interest is in general pediatrics and has a special affinity for and training in nutrition (‚ÄúFood as Medicine‚Äù) as well as genetics. He spent his first four years after residency on the Navajo reservation- a unique and deeply meaningful experience for him. Dr. Colgrove is board-certified and has been practicing pediatric medicine for over 25 years.

Dr. Colgrove moved to Eugene in 2013 and is married to his wife who grew up in a small village in Kenya. They have two wonderful children in college in Seattle. The past three years of both his personal and professional lives have been transformed by learning about nutrition and Lifestyle Medicine. Applying this new-found science has brought new insights in the understanding and application of disease prevention and health promotion.

Dr. Colgrove joined our practice in 2023, and is excited to be at Community Health Centers where he can really focus on the health and happiness of his patients and community.

Dr. Colgrove enjoys learning about other cultures, playing board games, the outdoors and learning about nutrition and cooking.

PurpleTeamClinic Location:

RiverStone Clinic

2073 Olympic Street

Springfield, OR 97477

Phone:

(541) 682-3550

Specialty:

Family Practice

Language Skills:

English

Laurel Decou earned her masters of nursing degree from the University of California, San Francisco in 2022. She is a member of the American Association of Nurse Practitioners.

Laurel joined our practice in 2023. She speaks some Spanish and French. Laurel grew up in Oregon, mainly in the Eugene area. After living out of state for many years, she is excited to be back here with her family, including her husband and their two kids. She loves books and is big fan of the library. The rest of her time she‚Äôd rather be outside gardening, hiking and camping.

Clinic Location:

Springfield Schools Health Center 1050 10th Street

Springfield, OR 97477

Phone:

(541) 682-3550

Specialty:

Pediatrics, ages 0-16

Language Skills:

English

Enyo earned her Bachelor of Science degree in Human Development and Psychological Services from Northwestern University in 2002. She completed her Health Sciences post-baccalaureate from the University of Oregon in 2004 and earned her graduate degree in Nursing from Yale School of Nursing in 2007. Enyo is certified by the Pediatric Nursing Certification Board. Enyo joined our practice in 2016.

Enyo‚Äôs first job out of graduate school was in a pediatric specialty clinic in San Francisco for 3.5 years working in pediatric endocrinology treating children with Type 1 & 2 diabetes, growth hormone, thyroid, and pubertal conditions. She went on to take a position at The Children‚Äôs Hospital of Philadelphia in the Endocrine department for 5.5 years treating a rare condition in children that were admitted to this hospital from all over the country and internationally.

Enyo grew up in Oregon and attended high school in Eugene. After marrying and having a baby Enyo and her husband decided to be closer to family. She enjoys spending time with her family, outdoor activities and sporting events. Enyo is happy to be back in Oregon, working to keep kids healthy.

Clinic Location:

Charnelton Community Clinic

151 West 7th Ave. Suite 100

Eugene, OR 97401

Phone:

(541) 682‚Äê3550

Specialty:

Behavioral Health Consultant

Language Skills:

English

Denna received a Bachelors of Science degree with a Major in Sociology and Minor in the SAPP Substance Abuse Prevention Program from the University of Oregon in 2012. She earned her Masters of Social Work degree from Portland State University in 2016.

Additional qualifications for Denna include: Students in Service Volunteer, AmeriCorps, National & Community Service Education Award Recipient 2008-2009; Lane County Volunteer 2007 ‚Äì 2019; Enhanced Illness Management Recovery Pilot Project 2013-2014; National Association of Drug and Alcohol Counselor Independent Study on Integrated Care Co-occurring Disorders 2015; Health Resources Administration Integrated Care Project in Rural Community with Youth Population 2015-2016; Oregon Health Authority Addictions and Mental Health Advisory Council Member and Treatment Subcommittee Member 2016 ‚Äìcurrent; Department of Human Services and Oregon Health Authority Liaison for Dual Diagnosis Populations 2012-current.

Denna joined our practice in 2019. She grew up in Washington State and moved to Oregon in 1988. Denna and her husband have two cats they adore. Denna‚Äôs hobbies include photography and journaling. She also enjoys outdoor activities such as hiking, snow skiing, swimming, walks on the beach, as well as zip lining and bungee jumping!

Gray Team

Clinic Location:

Delta Oaks Clinic

1022 Green Acres Road

Eugene, OR 97408

Phone:

(541) 682-3550

Specialty:

Family Practice, ages 18+

Language Skills:

English, Indonesian

Ranilla earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in Communication from the Universitas Jenderal Soedirman in Indonesia in 2006. She then completed her Bachelor of Science degree in Nursing at the Oregon Health & Science University in 2013, and earned a Master of Physician Assistant Studies from the Oregon Health & Science University in 2021. Ranilla is a member of the American Academy of Physician Associates. She speaks English and Indonesian which is her native language.

Ranilla was born and raised in Indonesia. She moved to the Pacific Northwest in 2008. She enjoys traveling and her favorite locations have been Southeast Asia, Scandinavia, and Southern-Central Europe. She enjoys spicy food, and loves experimenting new recipes in her spare time.

Dandelion Team

Clinic Location:

Charnelton Community Clinic

151 West 7th Ave

Suite 100

Eugene, OR 97401

Phone:

(541) 682-3550

Specialty:

Family Practice, ages 18+

Language Skills:

English

Dr. Murison graduated from the National University of Natural Medicine in Portland Oregon in 2010 and has been practicing for over 10 years in various facilities throughout Oregon. He joined our practice in September, 2021.

He has a passion for family medicine, natural medicine, LGBTQ+ care as well as gender affirming care.

Dr. Murison was born and raised in Mountaindale Oregon, then moved to Beaverton with his husband before deciding to make the move down to Eugene to join the Lane County community. Dr. Murison enjoys taking advantage of the vast outdoor spaces that Oregon has to offer by hiking, biking and skiing. He also enjoys and actively participates in local volleyball groups in the area.

Gold Team

Clinic Location:

Delta Oaks Clinic

1022 Green Acres Road

Eugene, OR 97408

Phone:

(541) 682-3550

Specialty:

Family Practice, all ages

Language Skills:

English

Jason initially received his Bachelor of Arts degree in sociology/anthropology from St. Olaf College in Northfield, Minnesota. He then received his Bachelor of Science degree in nursing from the College of St. Scholastica in Duluth, Minnesota. Upon graduation, he moved to Fargo, North Dakota and worked as a registered nurse for three years on a medical/surgical floor gaining valuable experience in the treatment of a wide variety of illnesses and diseases. While working as a registered nurse, Jason completed his Master of Science in Nursing degree in Family Medicine from the College of St. Scholastica. He is board-certified as a nurse practitioner through the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) in Family Medicine. He is also a member of the American Association of Nurse Practitioners (AANP). Jason joined our practice in 2015.

Jason expresses ‚ÄúI am thankful for the opportunity to work for Community Health Center of Lane County. I enjoy the challenge and satisfaction of managing both acute and chronic illness as well as promoting health and well-being across the lifespan in family medicine.‚Äù In his spare time, Jason enjoys reading, hiking, and competing in running and triathlon races.

Green Team

Clinic Location

RiverStone Clinic

2073 Olympic Street

Springfield, OR 97477

Phone:

(541) 682-3550

Specialty:

Family Practice

Language Skills:

English

Kristan received her bachelor‚Äôs degree in Human Physiology in 2021 and earned her Master of Physician Assistant Studies degree at OHSU in 2013. She is a member of the OSPA and AAPA. Kristan has worked in primary care, urgent care, spinal injury hospital and long-term care facility.

She joined our practice in 2022. Kristan speaks some Spanish, and is hoping to become fluent so she can see Spanish-speaking patients on her own, without interpreting assistance.

Kristan grew up in Thurston, Springfield and graduated from Thurston High School. She lived in England for 6 months while she worked at a spinal injury hospital. Her family started fostering dogs in 2021 and has helped 23 dogs so far. She loves to bake and celebrate anything! Kristan and her wife have been together for 16 years and have four children, three boys and one girl.

Purple Team

Clinic Location

RiverStone Clinic

2073 Olympic Street

Springfield, OR 97477

Phone:

(541) 682-3550

Specialty:

Family Practice

Language Skills:

English

Dr. Turner earned her medical degree from the University of Missouri School of Medicine in 2011. She completed a residency at John Peter Smith Family Hospital in Fort Worth, Texas in 2014. Dr. Turner had training in rural medicine and obstetrics. She is a member of the American Academy of Family Physicians and is board certified in Family Medicine by the American Board of Family Physicians.

Dr. Turner joined our practice in 2023. She is originally from the Midwest but discovered the beautiful Pacific Northwest and ultimately decided to move here long-term. She enjoys travel, simple living, reading, hiking, and camping. In her time off, she can frequently be found hiking through the woods or near the beach, visiting a local festival, or perusing a local bookstore.

Clinic Location:

RiverStone Clinic

2073 Olympic Street

Springfield, OR 97477

Phone:

(541) 682-3550

Specialty:

Family Practice, ages 18+

Language Skills:

English, Spanish

Scott is a Physician Associate at the RiverStone Clinic working in Family Medicine. He graduated Physician Associate school at Oregon Health and Science University in 2005. Scott is board certified in Lifestyle Medicine. He joined our practice in 2024. Scott is a strong Spanish speaker.

Scott was born and raised in Eugene, Oregon. He shares, ‚ÄúI was a professional bicycle racer, and then moved my family to the Portland area for school to become a Paramedic, and then ultimately to become a Physician Associate. I learned about Lifestyle Medicine when my own health challenges lead me to study the science of Nutrition and the benefits of lifestyle change. I am passionate about improving the health of my patients, family and friends utilizing therapeutic lifestyle change, including using food as medicine. I teach free classes on Nutrition and Lifestyle Medicine with some of my physician colleagues, both online and in person. I also enjoy bicycle riding, college sports, and spending time with family and friends. I am excited to join the Community Health Centers of Lane County team.‚Äù

Fuchsia Team

Clinic Location:

Brookside Clinic

1680 Chambers St Suite 103

Eugene, OR 97402

Phone:

(541) 682-3550

Specialty:

Family practice, all ages

Language Skills:

English

Ellis Whalen is a nurse practitioner with the Community Health Centers of Lane County at the Brookside Clinic. She is a board-certified family nurse practitioner through the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC). Ellis received her Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) graduate degree from Regis College in 2022, her bachelor‚Äôs degree in Biology from Texas A&M University in 2014 and a Bachelor of Science degree in nursing from Denver College of Nursing in 2016. Ellis moved from Denver, Colorado to Eugene in early 2022 and is excited to serve the community as a provider with the Community Health Centers of Lane County. She is familiar with the Community Health Centers as she completed a year of her family medicine clinical rotations at our Delta Oaks Clinic. Ellis has worked as a registered nurse and clinical educator with diverse experiences in pediatrics, medical surgical nursing, rural community health, and long-term care nursing. She is passionate about patient empowerment, education, and the provision of holistic, patient-centered primary care services for patients across the lifespan. Ellis is an active member of the Oregon Nurses Association and the American Association of Nurse Practitioners. In her spare time, Ellis enjoys hiking, long-distance running, reading, and spending time with her partner and two dogs.

Jennifer earned a Bachelor of Science in Dental Hygiene with a minor in business from the Oregon Institute of Technology. She obtained her dental hygiene license in 2009, her expanded practice dental hygienist permit in 2015, and her certification as a certified oral systemic educator in 2022. She is a member of several associations, including the Oregon Dental Hygiene Association, the National Network of Healthcare Hygienists, the National Network for Oral Health Access, and the American Dental Hygiene Association.

Jennifer feels incredibly fortunate to be able to serve both adults and children in the community where she grew up. She has an immense passion towards preventative dentistry, improving oral health outcomes, and educating patients regarding the connection between systemic and oral health.

Outside of the CHCLC, Jennifer loves spending time with her husband and her family, attending concerts, traveling, being active, and supporting the Oregon Ducks football team.

Melinda (Mindy) Davis started her career in 2005 as a dental assistant for the Air Force Reserves. In 2011, she decided to return to school to complete her Dental Hygiene education. She graduated from Lane Community College, where she earned her Associates Degree of Applied Science in Dental Hygiene including the Expanded Practice Permit in 2015. She joined Community Health Centers of Lane County in October of 2021 working with the dental outreach program working as an Expanded Practice Dental Hygienist, where she has found her passion being able to serve the children in our community.

Mindy has worked in private practice since 2015 as a Registered Dental Hygienist, and continues to work part time serving her patients of all ages. She has a passion to provide exceptional dental care along with providing information about the importance of dental care and building a connection with all those around her.

In her free time, Mindy loves to spend time with her husband Jason and their two dogs (Kimber and Axel) and relax with their cat (Whiskers). She loves to travel, spending time with family, exploring the outdoors and staying active fishing, boating and camping on the rivers.

Emily received an Associates of Art degree in 2004 and a Associates of Applied Science degree in Dental Hygiene in 2006. She holds a State Certified School Based Sealant Program certification and participates in annual continuing education opportunities at the Oregon Dental Conference.

Emily speaks and writes Spanish. She joined Community Health Centers of Lane County in 2006 as an extra help employee and now is a permanent employee.

Emily enjoys helping the ‚Äúlittles‚Äù of our world to grow and have health. She also loves to be in motion with snowboarding, playing roller derby, skating outdoors and hiking in the woods. Lane County is beautiful and Emily feels so lucky to live here. You will find her in the woods when she is not at work.

Sandra started working for Lane County as an Expanded Function Dental Assistant for the Lane Community College Dental Clocktower Clinic in 2008. After graduating from the Dental Hygiene program at LCC, Sandra started working for Lane County as a Registered Dental Hygienist then expanded her functions as an Expanded Practice Dental Hygienist. Sandra was born in Eugene, but grew up in Southern Oregon. She moved back here in 1995 to raise her children and go to school to become a Dental Hygienist. She loves rafting and hiking and being a Grandma! Sandra‚Äôs favorite part of working for Lane County is helping children in Lane County with their oral health.

Alicia moved to Oregon in 2001, from West Virginia, where she was a massage therapist for 10 years, with her husband and 3 children.

Alicia graduated from Lane Community College with an Associate in Applied Science, Dental Hygiene in 2006. Alicia shares, ‚ÄúAs a third generation dental professional, I am honored to have worked for Community Health Centers of Lane County as an outreach Dental Hygienist since 2006. After participating in the Oregon State Smile Survey in 2007, I saw the tremendous need for children to receive dental prevention services in an outreach program.‚Äù

Alicia worked part -time at Community Health Centers and part-time in a private Dental Practice from 2006-20I0. She received her Expanded Practice Dental Hygiene permit in 2010 and a full-time position at Community Health Centers of Lane County and is now a Senior Expanded Practice Dental Hygienist.

Alicia holds a current Dental Hygiene position on The Oregon Board of Dentistry, since 2015, as well as many state and national committees, working to provide the highest level of dental care to the state of Oregon. She is on the Western Regional Examination Committee as a local anesthesia clinical examiner, and is an active member of American Dental Hygiene Association, where she also served on the ODHA Government Relations Council.

Alicia loves spending time with her family, as they all live locally, and she especially enjoy the many hours she gets to spend with her grandchildren. In her spare time she loves kayaking and gardening, especially fresh vegetables.
